entries.author: brian_d_foy
entries.text: The White Camel award recognizes and celebrates the non-technical achievements of a member of the Perl community. Know somebody who's deserving of that monochromatic humped Thank You this year? Submit their name to brian d foy!
entries.title: Nominate Perl heroes for the 2015 White Camel Awards

entries.author: sawyer_x
entries.text: The weekly, at-a-glance, view of what happened in the P5P world.
entries.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: November 2nd-9th

entries.author: andrew_solomon
entries.text: Andrew interviews Alexis Sukrieh and traces back with him the genesis of its creation, the Dancer micro-web framework.
entries.title: Alexis Sukrieh, choreographer of Perl's Dancer community

entries.text: The fifth installment, which will happen next April, of the DC-Baltimore Perl Workshop is revving up.  If you want to be part of the fun, now is the time to submit your talks.
entries.title: DC-Baltimore Perl Workshop 2016!!! Call for Speakers

entries.author: dan_wright
entries.text: So, where's the next YAPC::NA going to be? Turns out the answer has... not yet stabilized yet. Dan fills us on the current state of affair.
entries.title: YAPC::NA::2016 Update #1

entries.author: yanick_champoux
entries.text: A new module that alters the behavior of Test::More's subtest such as to allow to only run a subset of a file's tests.
entries.title: Win Some, Test::Some

entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: What is the 'plan' in the tests written in Perl?
entries.title: Test plan and test descriptions

entries.author: ron_savage
entries.text: GraphViz is deprecated. Long live GraphViz2!
entries.title: Formal deprecation of GraphViz V 2.19 - Use GraphViz2

entries.text: There is a brand new CMS in town.
entries.title: CMS based Mojolicious

entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: Dancer now allows you to create your own skeleton for new projects. This is a skeleton that makes it easy to create a Single-Page Application. One where your client-side applications talks to the web serve using AJAX.
entries.title: Single Page Application with Perl Dancer and AngularJS

entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: All the Perl Maven articles related to Perl Dancer, now available bundled in one e-book in MOBI format for Kindle.
entries.title: Perl Dancer book available

entries.text: Halloween is behind us. As Ed Stark would undoubiously say: Christmas is coming.
entries.title: Production Today

entries.text: Pawel is considering putting his shoulder to the task of porting Rakudo to JavaScript, and he's asking for feedback as what should be his first concrete goalpost.
entries.title: What should Rakudo-js aim for first?

entries.author: miguel_prz
entries.text:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.
entries.title: NICEPERL's lists

header: This week's biggest news is actually a non-news type of news: YAPC::NA is still looking for its 2016 location. But despite this meddling, temporary snag, the bigger show goes on. brian d foy is now taking nominations for the 2015 White Camel Award, and there's a DC-Baltimore Perl Workshop coming in in the new year. Enjoy! ~ `/anick
subject: Nominations for the White Camel Award: It's On
